intro: Moluccella scariosa, commonly known as the scarious moluccella, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes many species of violets and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, violet or purple flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Moluccella scariosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
